title: 117 Best Copycat Recipes - Best Homemade Fast Food Ideas
description: Anything they can do, you can do better.
body: <style type="text/css">#sidepanel{transform:translateX(0);visibility:visible;content-visibility:auto;}@media (max-width:425px){#sidepanel{width:7rem;max-width:7rem;}#sidepanel .nav-item,#sidepanel .nav-item a,#sidepanel footer a,#sidepanel div a,#sidepanel a span{font-size:10px;}#sidepanel ul,#sidepanel div{padding:0;margin:0;}#sidepanel button{display:none;}}</style>SearchMy RecipesSubscribeMembership BenefitsRecipesMealsHolidaysFood TrendsNewsKitchen Tips & ToolsAll VideosAbout UsNewsletterDelish ShopFollowOther EditionsYour Privacy ChoicesPrivacy NoticeTerms Of UseSkip to ContentRecipesDinnersSpring RecipesKitchen TipsNewsSubscribesign inSearchLemon Blueberry DessertsSpring SaladsCopycat Recipe IdeasBrunch RecipesSpring DinnersMeals & CookingRecipe Headquarters117 Copycat Recipes That Taste Just Like The Real Thing117 Copycat Recipes That Taste Just Like The Real ThingAnything they can do, you can do better.By Camille LowderUpdated: Apr 2, 2025Save ArticlePHOTO: BRYAN GARDNER; FOOD STYLING: MAKINZE GOREWe LOVE copycats here at Delish. Not only is it fun to try and figure out just exactly what makes our favorite restaurant dishes as good as they are, there are myriad other reasons  to make these imitation recipes at home: cost efficiency, being able to control ingredients, being able to try foods from places located too far away (or that are closed certain days of the week, ahem Chick-fil-A), avoiding shrinking portion sizes... the list goes on. We‚Äôve got tons of options here, from sit-down spots like The Cheesecake Factory to caffeine hot-spot Starbucks, with tons of fast-casual and fast food in between. Check out our list of 117 copycat recipes for ideas, and get ready to never have to deal with the drive-thru or not getting the good booth again. üòâWhile we try not to eat out for every meal, with this list of restaurant copycats, you could enjoy a homemade meal that tastes just like your favorite take-out or to-go spots for every meal of the day. Looking for a fun breakfast option? Try our McDonald's McGriddle, our Starbucks vanilla bean Frappuccino, our Cracker Barrel hash brown casserole, or our IHOP pancakes. Need something extra yummy for lunch? You could go with a burger or sandwich, like our copycat Steak 'N Shake Frisco melt, our Carl‚Äôs Jr. bacon Western cheeseburger, our Panera chicken frontega panini, or our copycat Big Mac. Leaning for something a little lighter? Check out our Chipotle chicken burrito bowls, our Panera green goddess Cobb salad, or our Copycat Cheesecake Factory Mexican tortilla salad.Is your family clamoring to go out to eat for dinner, but you want to make a home-cooked meal? Satisfy everyone with dishes like our CPK BBQ chicken pizza, our Olive Garden 5-cheese ziti al forno, our Cheesecake Factory shrimp scampi, or our Panda Express orange chicken. Feel free to mix and match when it comes to sides too‚ÄîTexas Roadhouse rolls with Olive Garden madeira chicken, our P.F. Changs wonton soup alongside our '90s mall-style Instant Pot bourbon chicken, Chili's Nashville hot mozzarella sticks alongside some copycat pizza Hot Pockets‚Ä¶ It‚Äôs your restaurant, er, kitchen, so make your meals exactly how you want them!And don‚Äôt think we forgot about dessert. We‚Äôve got all the best bakery and supermarket cookies, as well as some of the most spectacular restaurant (and theme park, we love you Disney!) desserts too. Love chocolate chip cookies? You‚Äôre in luck‚Äîwe‚Äôve included copycats from DoubleTree Inn, Levain, Mrs. Fields, Tate‚Äôs, and more here. Not a chocolate chip fan? Check out our Crumbl chilled sugar cookies, our Pepperidge Farm‚Äôs milanos and chessmen cookies, or our Carr‚Äôs ginger lemon creams instead. Craving cake? The Cheesecake Factory‚Äôs cheesecakes are the BEST‚Äîwe‚Äôve got the OG cheesecake, a mango- Key lime version, and an Oreo version you‚Äôre going to love. Feel free to get creative with these‚Äîdecorate them exactly like they do, or have fun with it and change it up.1McDonald's Filet-O-FishPHOTO: RYAN LIEBE; FOOD STYLING: MAKINZE GOREInvented in 1962, the Filet-O-Fish was the first non-burger sandwich to be added to the McDonald‚Äôs menu. It was developed because of falling hamburger sales on meat-abstaining Fridays leading up to Easter. Fast forward to today, it‚Äôs one of the core items on the menu. TMYK!Get the McDonald's Filet-O-Fish recipe.2Copycat Hawaiian PunchPHOTO: JOSEPH DE LEO; FOOD STYLING: TAYLOR ANN SPENCERStore-bought Hawaiian Punch has only 3% juice, and its second ingredient, after water, is high-fructose corn syrup. If that's uh, not your cup of tea punch, you've got to try this recipe. It doesn't even have to be bright red if you don't want (but if you do, a few drops of food coloring will do ya).Get the Copycat Hawaiian Punch recipe.Advertisement - Continue Reading Below3Copycat Chili's Nashville Hot Mozzarella SticksPHOTO: ANDREW BUI; FOOD STYLING: MAKINZE GOREThese mozzarella sticks are glazed in the sauce you‚Äôd normally see on Nashville hot chicken. It‚Äôs spicy and smoky with a little bit of sweetness. Serve these with ranch dressing to help mellow out the spiciness of the sauce‚Äîwhether you're at Chili‚Äôs or at home, it's a must.Get the Copycat Chili's Nashville Hot Mozzarella Sticks recipe.4Copycat Chick-Fil-A Chicken Tortilla SoupPHOTO: RACHEL VANNI; FOOD STYLING: MAKINZE GOREChick-fil-A‚Äôs chicken tortilla soup boasts a (very!) dedicated fan base, and we can see why: It‚Äôs packed with rotisserie chicken, beans, corn, and a blend of cozy spices, making it the perfect comfort food to warm up with. Whipping up a homemade version is the next best thing.Get the Copycat Chick-Fil-A Chicken Tortilla Soup recipe.Advertisement - Continue Reading Below5Copycat Pizza Hot PocketsPHOTO: RACHEL VANNI; FOOD STYLING: BARRETT WASHBURNETo recreate the beloved pizza Hot Pocket, we used canned pizza dough, store-bought marinara, cheese, and pepperoni. The egg wash gives the crust a beautiful shine and helps it get golden brown. It's the upgrade the classic snack needs.Get the Copycat Pizza Hot Pockets recipe.6Cracker Barrel MeatloafPHOTO: JOSEPH DE LEO; FOOD STYLING: ADRIENNE ANDERSONWhile you might think meatloaf is meatloaf, lots of Americans really love the version sold at Cracker Barrel restaurants. Made with ground beef, crushed Ritz crackers, a sweet‚Äìtangy ketchup glaze, and more, this Cracker Barrel copycat version is well worth making. Here‚Äôs how to make their recipe at home, no road trip required.Get the Cracker Barrel Meatloaf recipe.Advertisement - Continue Reading Below7Copycat Panda Express Chow MeinANDREW BUIThe exact origins of chow mein are not entirely clear, but historians suspect this dish was born in northern China millennia ago. Thousands of years later, it‚Äôs been popularized by a beloved chain with a cute panda mascot. Now you can make it at home!Get the Copycat Panda Express Chow Mein recipe.8Copycat Chobani Yogurt Protein DrinksPHOTO: RACHEL VANNI ; FOOD STYLING: BROOKE CAISONGetting all your protein in doesn‚Äôt have to be a wallet-busting nightmare‚Äîthese protein-packed, 5-minute copycat Chobani yogurt drinks will help you start the day off feeling full, focused, and fiscally responsible.Get the Copycat Chobani Yogurt Protein Drinks recipe.Advertisement - Continue Reading Below9Chocolate Crumb Cake Crumbl Cookie CopycatPHOTO: BRYAN GARDNER; FOOD STYLING: MAKINZE GOREImagine biting into a warm, soft cookie that perfectly balances rich chocolate and the subtle warmth of cinnamon that a crumb or coffee cake is known for...this recipe makes it a reality. This isn‚Äôt just any cookie, either‚Äîit‚Äôs a decadent experience, capturing the essence of Crumbl‚Äôs famous chocolate cookie.Get the Chocolate Crumb Cake Crumbl Cookie Copycat recipe.10Copycat Egg McMuffinPHOTO: RYAN LIEBE; FOOD STYLING: SAM SENEVIRATNEWhen the McDonald‚Äôs drive-through window is closed, you can rely on this easy-to-follow copycat recipe for backup. All you need are some English muffins, Canadian bacon, American cheese, and eggs!Get the Copycat Egg McMuffin recipe.Advertisement - Continue Reading Below11Copycat Olive Garden Limoncello LemonadePHOTO: RACHEL VANNI; FOOD STYLING: BROOKE CAISONThe recipe is very simple, but we do recommend that you use limoncello AND a citrus-infused vodka. What we‚Äôre looking for here is to build lemon flavor in every step.Get the Copycat Olive Garden Limoncello Lemonade recipe.12Copycat Steak 'N Shake Frisco MeltPHOTO: RACHEL VANNI; FOOD STYLING: MAKINZE GOREIf two butter-smothered toasted slices of sourdough bread with a tangy creamy dressing on one slice and some classic caramelized onions on the other, with the pi√®ce de r√©sistance smashed burger with two slices of silky melted cheese in the middle sounds good to you, then this is about to become your new favorite lunch star.Get the Copycat Steak 'N Shake Frisco Melt recipe.Advertisement - Continue Reading Below13Copycat Big MacPHOTO: ANDREW BUI; FOOD STYLING: TIFFANY SCHLEIGHThis is my stab at making a copycat version of the classic at home: ‚ÄúI‚Äôm lovin‚Äô it,‚Äù and I know you will too! The best part? Don‚Äôt love pickles? Want a different kind of cheese? Prefer lettuce wraps to a bun? With a copycat, you can ‚Äúhave it your way‚Äù (including using whichever fast food jingles you want üòâ!). Get the Copycat Big Mac recipe.14Copycat Chick-fil-A NuggetsLUCY SCHAEFFER PHOTOGRAPHYChick-fil-A's lightly breaded morsels of golden chicken breast take the top spot for people's favorite fast food nuggets. This copycat recipe allows you the joys of eating incredible chicken nuggets without having to step foot into a restaurant‚Äîand you'll save a couple of bucks too.Get the Copycat Chick-fil-A Nuggets recipe.Advertisement - Continue Reading Below15Copycat Trader Joe's Green Goddess Salad DressingPHOTO: ERIK BERNSTEIN; FOOD STYLING: BARRETT WASHBURNEA fan favorite at Trader Joe‚Äôs is their green goddess salad dressing. It‚Äôs simple and fresh with bright lemon flavor and lots of creaminess (thanks avocados!). It‚Äôs no wonder they can't keep it in stock. Next time your local store runs out, make our copycat version instead.Get the Copycat Trader Joe's Green Goddess Salad Dressing recipe.16Copycat Starbucks Egg BitesPHOTO: JOSEPH DE LEO; FOOD STYLING: BROOKE CAISONGiving cold hard cash to Starbucks seems far-fetched in this economy, even if that cash is in exchange for their fluffy, cheesy, protein-packed egg bites. Lucky for you (and your wallet), we've figured out a perfect dupe for the iconic breakfast bites that will make you swear you shelled out $5 for a serving.Get the Copycat Starbucks Egg Bites recipe.Advertisement - Continue Reading Below17Copycat Cheesecake Factory Shrimp ScampiPHOTO & FOOD STYLING: JOEL GOLDBERGThis Cheesecake Factory staple is a seafood lover‚Äôs dream! The richness of the cream sauce is balanced by the acid of the tomatoes and the herbaceousness of the fresh basil. To top it all off, you'll add some golden breadcrumbs for a bit of crispy texture. Mmm.Get the Copycat Cheesecake Factory Shrimp Scampi recipe.18Crumbl Cookies & Cream CookiesPHOTO: RYAN LIEBE; FOOD STYLING: MAKINZE GOREToday, with 950 locations in the United States and a menu of rotating cookie flavors, Crumbl and their thick, chewy cookies are here, there, and nearly everywhere. But what if you want to make these legendary treats at home? Here are some tips for making your own copycat version of Crumbl‚Äôs cookies & cream cookies.Get the Crumbl Cookies & Cream Cookies recipe.Advertisement - Continue Reading Below19Copycat Klondike BarsPHOTO: ERIK BERNSTEIN; FOOD STYLING:MAKINZE GOREKlondike Bars are a freezer case staple, but what if we told you that it‚Äôs easy to make a homemade version with a simple no-churn ice cream and a two-ingredient DIY chocolate topping? IT'S TRUE.Get the Copycat Klondike Bars recipe.20Copycat Olive Garden MeatballsPHOTO: ERIK BERNSTEIN; FOOD STYLING: MAKINZE GOREAside from their signature breadsticks and their creamy zuppa toscana, one of Olive Garden‚Äôs most iconic dishes is their meatballs. Sauced in bright marinara and perched atop a glossy mound of spaghetti, they transform into a showstopping entr√©e that still manages to deliver those down-home comfort food vibes.Get the Copycat Olive Garden Meatballs recipe.Watch Next¬†Advertisement - Continue Reading BelowWildly Delicious Weeknight DinnersEnchilada CasseroleCauliflower TacosChicken FajitasCacio E Pepe ChickenAdvertisement - Continue Reading BelowPork Dumpling BowlsGreek Orzo SaladCheesy Taco Bake82 Simple Spring DinnersLemon Asparagus Pasta21 Recipes Meghan Markle Would Approve OfChicken Shawarma BowlsChicken & Broccoli CasseroleAdvertisement - Continue Reading BelowNewsletterSubscribeManage SubscriptionAbout UsDelish Test KitchenMedia KitCommunity GuidelinesAdvertise With UsDelish Shop Product SupportOther Hearst SubscriptionsDelish Unlimited Membership SupportTurn off Web NotificationsA Part of Hearst Digital MediaWe may earn commission from links on this page, but we only recommend products we back.¬©2025 Hearst Magazine Media, Inc. Check out our list of 117 copycat recipes for ideas, and get ready to never have to deal with the drive-thru or not getting the good booth again. üòâ\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eWhile we try not to eat out for \u003cem\u003eevery\u003c/em\u003e meal, with this list of restaurant copycats, you \u003cem\u003ecould\u003c/em\u003e\u003cem\u003e\u003c/em\u003e enjoy a homemade meal that tastes just like your favorite take-out or to-go spots for every meal of the day. Looking for a fun breakfast option? Not only is it fun to try and figure out just exactly what makes our favorite restaurant dishes as good as they are, there are myriad other reasons  to make these imitation recipes at home: cost efficiency, being able to control ingredients, being able to try foods from places located too far away (or that are closed certain days of the week, ahem Chick-fil-A), avoiding shrinking portion sizes... the list goes on. We‚Äôve got tons of options here, from sit-down spots like The Cheesecake Factory to caffeine hot-spot Starbucks, with tons of fast-casual and fast food in between. Check out our list of 117 copycat recipes for ideas, and get ready to never have to deal with the drive-thru or not getting the good booth again. üòâWhile we try not to eat out for every meal, with this list of restaurant copycats, you could enjoy a homemade meal that tastes just like your favorite take-out or to-go spots for every meal of the day. Looking for a fun breakfast option? Try our McDonald's McGriddle, our Starbucks vanilla bean Frappuccino, our Cracker Barrel hash brown casserole, or our IHOP pancakes. Need something extra yummy for lunch? You could go with a burger or sandwich, like our copycat Steak 'N Shake Frisco melt, our Carl‚Äôs Jr. bacon Western cheeseburger, our Panera chicken frontega panini, or our copycat Big Mac. Leaning for something a little lighter? Check out our Chipotle chicken burrito bowls, our Panera green goddess Cobb salad, or our Copycat Cheesecake Factory Mexican tortilla salad.Is your family clamoring to go out to eat for dinner, but you want to make a home-cooked meal? Satisfy everyone with dishes like our CPK BBQ chicken pizza, our Olive Garden 5-cheese ziti al forno, our Cheesecake Factory shrimp scampi, or our Panda Express orange chicken. Feel free to mix and match when it comes to sides too‚ÄîTexas Roadhouse rolls with Olive Garden madeira chicken, our P.F. Changs wonton soup alongside our '90s mall-style Instant Pot bourbon chicken, Chili's Nashville hot mozzarella sticks alongside some copycat pizza Hot Pockets‚Ä¶ It‚Äôs your restaurant, er, kitchen, so make your meals exactly how you want them!And don‚Äôt think we forgot about dessert. We‚Äôve got all the best bakery and supermarket cookies, as well as some of the most spectacular restaurant (and theme park, we love you Disney!) desserts too. Love chocolate chip cookies? You‚Äôre in luck‚Äîwe‚Äôve included copycats from DoubleTree Inn, Levain, Mrs. Fields, Tate‚Äôs, and more here. Not a chocolate chip fan? Check out our Crumbl chilled sugar cookies, our Pepperidge Farm‚Äôs milanos and chessmen cookies, or our Carr‚Äôs ginger lemon creams instead. Craving cake? The Cheesecake Factory‚Äôs cheesecakes are the BEST‚Äîwe‚Äôve got the OG cheesecake, a mango- Key lime version, and an Oreo version you‚Äôre going to love.
